Syria: After Druze killings, Sweida barricades itself in defiance of Syrian authorities
subhead: Large numbers of civilians were executed in the southern Syrian city amid clashes that pitted local factions against Bedouin fighters and forces loyal to Damascus. The massacre has intensified separatist sentiment among the Druze minority.

title: 'If a dictator issued a call for tenders to reopen gulags, some consulting firms would be ready to bid'
subhead: Many consulting firms no longer hesitate to work on the most outrageous proposals, such as the mass displacement of Gaza residents or opioid overdosing. David Naïm, himself a consultant, wonders in his column how things have come to this point.

title: Earning a good living, yet feeling poor: How social media creates financial dysmorphia
subhead: Money flaunts itself on social media, exposing Gen Z's obsession with wealth as the ultimate goal. Luxury hotels, lavish vacations, expensive clothes: These images warp our relationship with reality, leading some to develop a distorted perception of their financial situation.

title: A year later, French fans relive the 'non-stop joy' of Paris 2024
subhead: The success of the summer 2024 event was also thanks to the fervor of fans at the competition venues. One year later, several of them recall the "incredible excitement" that swept the French capital.
